content: And no matter how you skin this cat, I mean $550 billion on top of the current FAST Act, which is probably going to be extended by 5 years, that's what's being proposed by the Biden proposal and the bill that has been put forward, is going to translate somewhere between 20% to 30% higher demand for cement in the U.S. And we all know that there are some very important environmental -- I don't want to call it prohibitions, but certainly environmental, let's say, pressures and headwinds in adding new capacity.
